Class Repository

java.lang.Object
br.ufal.ic.p2.jackut.Repository
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Repository extends Object implements Serializable
The Repository class is responsible for managing users and sessions in the system. It follows the Singleton pattern to ensure a single instance is used throughout the application. This class also handles data persistence by saving and loading users and sessions from files.
See Also:

    • getInstance

      public static Repository getInstance()
      Returns the single instance of Repository, creating it if necessary.
      Returns:
      The singleton instance of Repository.

    • isCommunityCreated

      public boolean isCommunityCreated(String communityName)
      Checks if a community with the given name exists in the system.
      Parameters:
      communityName - The name of the community to check.
      Returns:
      true if the community exists, false otherwise.

    • newCommunity

      public void newCommunity(String name, Community community)
      Creates a new community in the system.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the new community.
      community - The Community object to be added.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either parameter is null.

    • getCommunityByName

      public Community getCommunityByName(String communityName) throws CommunityDoesntExistException

      Parameters:
      communityName - The name of the community to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The Community object.
      Throws:
      CommunityDoesntExistException - if no community with the given name exists.

      Returns:
      The community description.
      Throws:

      public String getCommunityOwner(String communityName) throws CommunityDoesntExistException
      Gets the owner of a specific community.
      Parameters:
      communityName - The name of the community.
      Returns:
      The login of the community owner.
      Throws:
      CommunityDoesntExistException - if no community with the given name exists.

    • getCommunitiesByLogin

      public ArrayList<String> getCommunitiesByLogin(String userLogin) throws UserNotFoundException
      Retrieves all communities that a user belongs to.
      Parameters:
      userLogin - The login of the user.
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing the names of all communities the user belongs to.
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - if the user doesn't exist or if an empty login is provided.

    • newSession

      public Session newSession(String login, String password) throws UserNotFoundException, InvalidPasswordOrLoginException
      Creates a new session for a user given their login and password.
      Parameters:
      login - The user's login.
      password - The user's password.
      Returns:
      A new Session object.
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - If the user does not exist.
      InvalidPasswordOrLoginException - If the password is incorrect.

    • getSession

      public Session getSession(String sessionId)
      Retrieves a session based on the session ID.
      Parameters:
      sessionId - The session ID.
      Returns:
      The corresponding Session object, or null if not found.

      public User getUserBySessionId(String id) throws UserNotFoundException

      Parameters:
      id - The session ID.
      Returns:
      The corresponding User object.
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - If the session ID does not exist.

    • addUser

      public void addUser(String login, String password, String name) throws UserAlreadyExistsException
      Adds a new user to the repository.
      Parameters:
      login - The user's login.
      password - The user's password.
      name - The user's name.
      Throws:
      UserAlreadyExistsException - If a user with the same login already exists.

      public void eraseEverything()
      Deletes all users, sessions and communities from the repository.

      public void editProfile(Session session, String atributo, String valor) throws EmptyAttributeException
      Edits a user profile attribute.
      Parameters:
      session - The session of the user.
      atributo - The attribute to modify.
      valor - The new value.
      Throws:
      EmptyAttributeException - If the provided attribute value is empty.

    • getUser

      public User getUser(String login) throws UserNotFoundException
      Retrieves a user by their login.
      Parameters:
      login - The login of the user.
      Returns:
      The User object.
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - If the user does not exist.

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(String login) throws UserNotFoundException
      Deletes a user and all associated data from the system. Performs a complete cleanup including: - Removing all user messages and community messages - Removing references from other users' messages - Handling owned communities (deletes them if user is owner) - Removing from friends lists - Cleaning session data
      Parameters:
      login - The login of the user to be deleted
      Throws:
      UserNotFoundException - If no user with the specified login exists Operation steps: 1. Verifies user existence 2. Clears all user messages 3. Removes user references from other users' messages 4. Handles communities owned by the user 5. Updates all users' community memberships 6. Removes user from friends lists 7. Cleans up user and session data
